name: sprite.velocityY
content:
Velocity in the positive y direction of the sprite in pixels per frame.

A positive value will move the sprite downward, a negative value will move upward. Must be used with the [`draw() {}`(#fff176)](/docs/gamelab/draw/) function containing a [`drawSprites()`(#fff176)](/docs/gamelab/drawSprites/).

The default velocityY is 0. All sprite properties can be both accessed and updated.

examples.name: Zig-Zag
examples.description: Move a sprite in a zig-zag pattern by alternating velocityY positive and negative.

return_value: Velocity in the positive y direction, downward.
short_description: Velocity in the positive y direction of the sprite in pixels per frame.
tips:
- velocityY can be used similarly to using the "counter pattern" on [`drawSprites()`(#fff176)](/docs/gamelab/drawSprites/) is called. 
 [`sprite.y`(#f78183)](/docs/gamelab/y/) within the [`draw() {}`(#fff176)](/docs/gamelab/draw/) function.
- Changing [`World.frameRate`(#fff176)](/docs/gamelab/World.frameRate/) will affect the velocityY.
- Sprites all have the same properties and you use the dot notation (combining the name of the sprite, followed by a dot, with the label of the property) to both access and update the property for that sprite.
- Any changes to the properties of a sprite will not be seen until after
